menu.glossary:
Welcome to the guide v2, {first_name}! Here you will find a lot of useful things about the Veganwars!
If you have any questions/suggestions for improving the guide - poke the creator (in the bot description) or use /feedback
The guide has the ability to change the language, for this enter the command - /set_l
staff_of_the_necromancer.glossary:
‚öî️|The Necromancer's Staff:
Summons a random npcs for 3 turns; during this time, the player gains a shield and cannot walk for him/herself - instead, he/she walks for the npcs.
‚ö†️ If the player is stunned during the summoning, the summoned creature is also stunned.
{staff_of_the_necromancer_info}

Called creatures:
Ghoul|👹
‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️|6 lives. Maximum: 6
‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️|6 energy. Maximum: 6
💔x4/4 wounds. Affects loss of lives
(You can lower the damage threshold to 3/4 with the axe.)
‚ñ™️ Vampirism: for every life taken, the ghoul regains a life.
‚ñ™️ Ghoul's Bloodthirstiness: for each life taken from a player, increases damage by +1.
‚ñ™️ Has the property of a gas mask - namely, it extinguishes if not set on fire. (but, light grenades work on him).
Weapon:
‚öî️|Ghoul's teeth.
{ghoul_teeth_info}

Skeleton|💀
‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️|4 lives. Maximum: 4
‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️|5 energy. Maximum: 5
‚ñ™️ Can attack immediately without approaching the target
Weapon:
‚öî️|Sword.
{skeleton_sword_info}

Zombie rat|🐭
‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️|4 lives. Maximum: 4
‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️|5 energy. Max: 5
‚ñ™️ Has random weapons, abilities, items
how_to_play.glossary:
‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️|4 lives. Maximum: 4
‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️|5 energy. Maximum: 5
🎯 🎯 🎯🎯🎯🎯🎯 97% chance of hitting.

Your standard stats - let's go over them.
‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️|4 lives. Maximum: 4 is your xp, if you have 0 lives, you lose. Your goal is to reduce your opponent's lives before they reduce yours.

‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️|5 energy. Maximum: 5 is your energy that is spent on attacking - on average, melee uses 2 energy per turn, ranged 3. There are weapons exceptions to the rules.

🎯|Probability to hit - 97% - the probability of hitting the enemy depends on the amount of current energy and accuracy of the weapon and additional abilities!

There is also a parameter invisible to the player - Damage Limit
Damage limit, aka damage threshold. If you deal damage that exceeds the player's damage limit, the player will lose 2 xp per turn!

So now let's get to the mechanics of battles, in front of you will be a few buttons -
Attack. Reload/Rest. Roll. Info. Advanced. Approach. Skip move.

Attack - as the name implies, you need to attack the opponent, expends energy. If there is no energy - the chance to hit is 0%, you can't damage the enemy. If at the very beginning of the battle when you press the attack button, you have no opponent - you need to approach and press the button of the same name. 

Recharge/Rest - click if you are out of or low on energy, restores energy completely.
|0 energy. Maximum: 5
🎯| 0% chance of hitting.

Chosen: recharge.

‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️|5 energy. Maximum: 5
🎯|Hit probability - 97%]

Roll - As the name suggests, this button is needed to dodge enemy attacks - does not guarantee 100% dodge (as it lowers enemy accuracy by 5).

Info - Needed to get rid of fear effect, otherwise useless.

Extras - There will be 💣 Items and some abilities that require activation.

Approach - needed if you have a melee weapon (including fists), not needed if you have a ranged weapon.

Skip move - needed to skip a move, as well as this button is needed to extinguish from fire.
dungeons.menu.glossary:
Welcome to the dungeon guide section.
Before you open the guide, read the warning from the developer:

Don't spoil your enjoyment of the game with dungeon tips, try to pass it yourself first!
dungeon.rhino.glossary:
🕳 First floor
Opponents: rat (number of rats = number of players going through the dungeon).

The rat is random, so no tips.

🕳 Second floor:
Opponents: rat, skeleton (number of rats and skeletons = number of players passing the dungeon)

For effective passing it is recommended:
‚úÖ Spear - biceps, concentration, berserk.
‚úÖ Grenade launcher - sadist, scope/visor/thief, gas mask, alchemist.
dungeon.rhino.three_flour.glossary:
🕳 Third floor:
Opponents: Rhino (in @Veganwars_rebuild_bot with 3+ players there will be 2 rhinos)

{rhino_characteristics}

Basic rhino attack pattern (without rage):
Dash > attack > attack > rest
Basic rhino attack pattern (with rage)
Dash > attack > attack > attack > rest

Walkthrough tips (solo):
Let's start with weapons, there are weapons that will be effective against the rhino, and there are weapons that will be little or no effective at all, and neutral

‚úÖ Effective: knife, sawblade, saber, pole, brass knuckles, police baton, steel claws, cleaver.
‚ùåFew and ineffective: axe, flamethrower, bow, sniper rifle, shotgun, sawed-off shotgun, chain, mace.  
Neutral:
Everything else

Recommended abilities:
Ninja, strong skull, biceps, concentration, inquisitor, medic, biped, shield generator, alchemist, armourer (depending on weapon)

The walkthrough itself:
Rhino Actions:
(‚ö†️ please note, I do not take into account police baton, brass knuckles, light grenade, knocking down, parrying, and more)
Dash > attack > attack > rest
Move 1: Dash 
Move 2: Attack 
Move 3: Attack 
Move 4: Rest 

‚ñ´️ Move 1: I suggest rolling; even if you have a light grenade, I recommend holding it until the rhino rage; the same goes for parrying a saber, if you parry, chances are you'll still get stunned and lose a move.
If you have an alchemist, you can roll and use rabies serum on yourself.

Now the rhino will act like this:
attack > attack > rest
Move 2: Attack 
Move 3: Attack 
Move 4: Rest 

‚ñ´️ Move 2. Attack/shield/inquisitor pray for rhino/throw throwing knife
‚ñ´️ Move 3. Recharge/attack (depends on the amount of current energy, since the rhino will be resting, you should hit it on turn 4)
‚ñ´️ move 4. Attack

Now the rhino will act like this:
Dash > attack > attack > attack > rest
Move 5: Roll 
Move 6: Attack 
Move 7: Attack 
Move 8: Rest 

‚ñ´️ Move 5. Since the roll is on cooldown, it is recommended to use shield, chitin, saber parry if none of these are available...🫡
‚ñ´️ move 6. Roll
‚ñ´️ move 7. Recharge/attack (depends on the amount of current energy, since the rhino will be resting, you should hit it on turn 8)
‚ñ´️ turn 8. Attack

If you're lucky, the rhino should be on a rampage by now
So, its pattern is now:
Dash > attack > attack > attack > rest
Move 9: Dash 
Move 10: Attack 
Move 11: Attack 
Move 12: Attack
Move 13: Rest 

‚ñ´️ move 9. If you have - light grenade, if not - roll, shield, chitin, sabre parry.... If none of these are available...🫡
‚ñ´️ move 10. Attack
‚ñ´️ move 11. Attack

If you're lucky, you've already won.... (or 100 times dead)
dungeon.rhino.solo_characteristics.gloss:
Rhino Characteristics (solo):
‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️|5 lives. Maximum: 5
‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️|3 energy. Max: 3
💔x9/9 wounds. Affects loss of lives
‚ñ™️Have 60% chance to block 2 units of damage per turn. 
‚ñ™️ Has the property of a gas mask - namely, it extinguishes if not set on fire. (but, light grenades work on him).
‚ñ™️ Fury comes when the rhino has 50% xp rounded down (i.e. when it has 2/5 life).
‚ñ™️ It has burst. It has a dash for 3 turns on cd. (i.e. if used on turn 1, the next turn 5).
‚ñ™️ When jarked, there is a 70% chance of stun.
‚ñ™️ If you are stunned (after being hit by the Dash or for other reasons) he can attack you, dealing +2 damage.
‚ñ™️ For each attack - he spends 1 energy.

💢 Fury:
‚ñ™️ Instantly restores 1 energy.  
‚ñ™️ Maximum Energy +1.  
‚ñ™️ Damage +1.  

Weapons: horn
‚öî️|Horn.
{horn_solo_info}
dungeon.rhino.teams.glossary:
{rhino_duo_characteristics}

{rhino_trio_characteristics}

Passing tips (in duo/trio):
‚úÖ Effective: knife, saw, sabre, pole, brass knuckles, police baton, steel claws, cleaver, mace, flamethrower
‚ùå Few and ineffective: axe, bow, sniper rifle, shotgun, sawed-off shotgun, chain.
Neutral: Everything else.

Too many nuances to write a detailed walkthrough for a pack, but, here are two very successful strategies anyway:
1. Each player should take a flamethrower and take turns, each turn, setting the rhino on fire, IMPORTANT, the fire on the rhino must not go out!
2. At least two players must take the ability ‚Äòdarkness‚Äô, the rhino must be stunned (chitin on the rhino, prayer of the inquisitor on the rhino), wait until the stun should work. The first player throws darkness a turn before the stun, the second player throws darkness during the stun turn. (As an example, if you throw chitin on the rhino on the first turn, the first player throws darkness at the rhino on the third turn, and the second player throws darkness at the rhino on the fourth turn).

‚ö†️ While the rhino is enraged, it:
‚ñ™️ Instantly regenerates n energy.  
‚ñ™️ Max energy +n.  
‚ñ™️ Damage +n.
Where n is each player in the dungeon; but in addition to the players, the rhino also gains bonus stats for zombies raised by the Necromancer ability, as well as for creatures from the Necromancer's staff.
Stats are changed only during the turn of rage (i.e. once), subsequent resurrections and summons do not give bonus stats to the rhino.
Rhinoceros Characteristics (duo):
‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️|6 lives. Maximum: 6
‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️|4 energy. Max: 4
💔x9/9 wounds. Affects loss of lives
‚ñ™️ Has a 60% chance to block 3 units of damage per turn. 
‚ñ™️ Has the property of a gas mask - namely, it extinguishes if not set on fire. (but, light grenades work on him).
‚ñ™️ Fury comes when the rhino has 50% xp rounded down (i.e. when it has 3/6 life).
‚ñ™️ Has dash. (+1 to damage) It has 3 turns of dash on cd. (i.e. If used on turn 1, the next turn 5).
‚ñ™️ When dashed, it has a 70% chance to stun.
‚ñ™️ If you are stunned (after being hit by the dash or for other reasons) he can attack you, dealing +2 damage.
‚ñ™️ For each attack - he spends 1 energy.

💢 Fury:
‚ñ™️ Instantly restores 2 energy.  
‚ñ™️ Max energy +2.
‚ñ™️ Damage +2.

Weapons: horn
‚öî️|Horn
{horn_duo_info}

Basic rhino attack pattern (no rage in duo):
dash > attack > attack > attack > rest
Rhino's basic attack pattern (with rage in duo):
dash > attack > attack > attack > dash > attack > rest

dungeon.necromancer.glossary:
🕳 First Floor
Opponents: decrepit skeleton (number of skeletons = number of players going through the dungeon).

‚ñ´️ It is necessary not to kill the skeleton. When the player has 1 life, the skeleton will surrender on its own

Recommendations:  
‚úÖAlchemist - use on the skeleton.  
‚úÖIf you are in a team (2+ players), take a ritualist:
First player (not the ritualist) press /suicide.
The second player (ritualist) throws a ritual on the first player.
On his next turn, throws lightning bolt at himself.

{second_floor}

{third_floor}
dungeon.necromancer.second_floor.glossar:
🕳 Second Floor
Opponents: decrepit skeleton, ghoul (number of skeletons and ghouls = number of players going through the dungeon). 

‚ñ´️ It is necessary not to kill the skeleton. After killing the ghoul, the skeleton will surrender itself.  

Ghoul|👹
‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️|6 lives. Maximum: 6.
‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️|5 energy. Maximum: 5
💔x4/4 wounds. Affects loss of lives
(You can lower the damage threshold to 3/4 with the axe.)
‚ñ™️ Vampirism: for every life taken, the ghoul regains a life.
‚ñ™️ Ghoul's Bloodthirstiness: for each life taken from a player, increases damage by +1.
‚ñ™️ Has the property of a gas mask - namely, it extinguishes if not set on fire. (but, light grenades work on him).

Weapon:
‚öî️|Ghoul's teeth
{ghoul_teeth_info}

For effective passing, it is recommended that you:
‚úÖ Recommended: sabre, cleaver, mace, axe, steel claws - biceps, concentration.
‚úÖ Shotgun, sniper rifle, pylot - scope.
‚úÖ Shield generator, ninja.
‚ùåIneffective: chain, flamethrower, brass knuckles.
‚ùåProhibited: grenade launcher, grenade, molotov cocktail, alchemist - can kill a skeleton.
dungeon.necromancer.third_floor.glossary:
🕳 Third floor 
Opponents: Necromancer

{necromancer_characteristics}

Passing tips (solo):
‚úÖ Recommended weapons: grenade launcher, sabre, pole
‚úÖ Recommended abilities: alchemist, strong skull, bipedalism, medic, shield generator, ninja.
Not recommended: Pyrotechnician, Berserk (as the fight will be long and there will be a ghoul among the enemies, it will be difficult to beat him on 1 xp), cleaver (as it loses damage bonus with attacks).

The walkthrough itself:
Necromancer itself does not attack or do anything.

‚ñ´️ Turn 1: approach or hit necromancer. 🔺Don't throw knife.

‚ñ´️ Now that you have attacked the necromancer - reload, as he spends a turn (and gets a shield) to summon minions. He will summon two decrepit skeletons
‚ñ´️ They will either approach or roll (if you have a ranged weapon). Throwing a grenade or a cocktail of hammers at the skeletons is recommended.

🔹 I strongly recommend that after minions die and before the next minions are summoned - do not attack the necromancer, but just skip moves - to restore the cooldown of the reroll and abilities

‚ñ´️ Now, when you have waited for all abilities to regenerate, attack the necromancer. After the attack, reload. He will summon the ghoul.
‚ñ´️ You just need to kill the ghoul as you did on the previous floor.
‚ñ´️ After killing the ghoul, again, do not attack the necromancer (watch 🔹).

‚ñ´️ When you have waited for all abilities to cooldown - attack the necromancer. After the attack - reload. He will summon a zombie rat.
‚ñ´️ Zombie rat, has random weapons, abilities and items. The rat is random, so there are no tips.

‚ñ´️ Once the zombie rat is dead, attack the Necromancer immediately‚Äîno need to wait for ability cooldowns; dungeon cleared.
dungeon.necromancer.necromancer_characte:
Necromancer|🖤
‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️|4 lives. Maximum: 4
‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️|5 energy. Maximum: 5
💔x1000/1000 wounds. Affects loss of life
‚ñ™️ Immune to bleed, ritual, last strike.
‚ñ™️ Reflects darkness energy into the player (casting 50 fear at once, killing the player).
‚ñ™️ Cannot improve pyrotechnic bomb (when improved, explodes the bomb causing 3 damage to the player (the bomb is lost)).
‚ñ™️ When losing lives - summons minions, until a minion is killed, the necromancer will be under an impenetrable shield.

Necromancer's minions:
‚ñ™️ At 3 life (‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️), summons two decrepit skeletons (+2 for each player).
‚ñ™️ At 2 life (‚ô•️‚ô•️), he summons one ghoul (+1 for each player).
‚ñ™️ At 1 life (‚ô•️), it summons one zombie rat (+1 per player).
dungeon.necromancer.interesting_facts.gl:
️Necromancer (at the moment), the only boss that does not change its characteristics, no matter how many players come to the dungeon.

‚óæ️ If you kill a decrepit skeleton, on the third floor (where the necromancer himself is) instead of normal combat, you will first have to kill huge evil skeletons (the number of huge evil skeletons depends on how many decrepit skeletons you killed on previous floors).

Huge evil skeleton|💀
‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️|12 lives. Maximum: 12
‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️|5 energy. Maximum: 5
💔x100/100 wounds. Affects loss of lives
Skills: Biceps
Weapon: Marble Column - 5‚ö°️
🎯|Hit probability - 100%

Weapon:
‚öî️|Marble Column
When hit, it stuns, knocks you down, and inflicts bleeding. Can deal 2x damage (i.e. 30 damage).
{marble_column_info}
 
‚óæ️ The necromancer has two endings after defeating him:

‚ñ´️This text appears after a regular Necromancer run:

You feel a strange power. You wave the staff‚Äîand a translucent barrier forms around you. A few seconds later, from the archway that serves as the entrance to this hall, the decrepit skeleton you chose not to kill appears.

💬Decrepit Skeleton|🦴: Maa-aa-aster! Gii-iive your co-o-ommands!

The power you felt is the power to command the dead. Along with it, you can now understand what they say. And your first command was...

💬Alex: Alex commands‚Äîyou are free!

💬Decrepit Skeleton|🦴: Thaa-aa-ank you...

The skeleton then crumbled into a simple pile of bones. Back in the first battle, you already sensed that even the afterlife tired him.
Once the command was carried out, the magical barrier around you vanished, and you felt a sudden drain of energy.

‚ñ´️And this one appears if you kill the giant skeleton and then the Necromancer:

You feel a strange power. You wave the staff‚Äîand a translucent barrier forms around you. A few seconds later, a skeleton digs its way out from the ground.

💬Skeleton|💀: Maa-aa-aster! Gii-iive your co-o-ommands!

The power you felt is the power to command the dead. Along with it, you can now understand what they say.

💬Alex: Alex commands‚Äîreturn to the earth!

💬Skeleton|💀: As you wii-iish!

The skeleton then buried itself back into the ground.

Once the command was carried out, the magical barrier around you vanished, and you felt a sudden drain of energy.

‚óæ️ If you prolong the battle (e.g. skip moves) you will get this text on the 150th move:

Move 150:
💬|Necromancer||🖤: I'm out of tea and candy, I don't want to wait any longer. Die now!
Effects 150:
💥‚ö°️|The hall shuddered. The entire ceiling was covered in black clouds, which a second later began showering the hall with lightning. All the heroes are dead, the game is over.
dungeon.necromancer.Tuman.glossary:

dungeon.dark.glossary:
🕳 First Floor:
Opponents: shadow rat (number of shadow rats = number of players going through the dungeon)

‚ñ´️ You need to select the ‚Äòmedic‚Äô ability before combat and give the stimulant to the shadow rat on the first turn.

After that it gets 2 life and can now be killed. It also gets random weapons, abilities and items. The rat is random, so no advice.

{second_floor}
dungeon.dark.second_floor.glossary:
🕳 Second Floor:
Opponents: amalgam (number of amalgams = number of players going through the dungeon)

Amalgam|🧿
‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️|6 lives. Maximum: 6
‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️|5 energy. Maximum: 5 
💔x38/38 wounds. Affects loss of lives
‚ñ™️ Mutation: restores energy during each mutation, and also has three forms of mutation:
‚ñ™️ Very Vicious Dog: bites two turns in a row after transformation
 ‚öî️|Dog's Mouth
{dog_maw_info}
‚ñ™️Human form: after transforming, attacks with a huge cleaver for 10 damage (but there's low accuracy, can miss)
 ‚öî️|Huge cleaver
{huge_cleaver_info}
‚ñ™️ Cannon: After transforming, spends a turn to ‚Äòcharge‚Äô the cannon, then fires it. On hit, the attack is guaranteed to remove 1 life and stun.
 ‚öî️|Shadow Cannon
{shadow_cannon_info}
‚ñ™️ The amalgam takes on a random form, but cannot apply the form it was just in. 
‚ñ™️ Fear: After completing the mutation, takes its ‚Äòtrue‚Äô form by imposing (2) fear on a random player. (But if ‚Äòinfo‚Äô is pressed once, subsequent impositions will impose (1) fear).
‚ñ™️ It has the property of a gas mask - namely, it extinguishes if not set on fire, but, it only extinguishes when it completes mutation! (but, light grenades work on it).

Tips for passing (solo):
‚úÖ Effective: knife, flamethrower, torch, bow, steel claws, saber.
‚ùå Few and ineffective: axe, sniper rifle, chain, mace, pole, knuckles.
The walkthrough itself:
‚ñ´️ Move 1: I recommend spending it either to approach (if you have a melee weapon) or to press info.

‚ñ´️ Against a dog I recommend attacking or reloading (if low on energy) or getting rid of fear (if more than 3 fear).
‚ñ´️ Against a cleaver I recommend using shield, parry.
‚ñ´️ Against the cannon, I recommend that while it is charging, attack or reload (if low on energy) or get rid of fear (if more than 3 fear), and use a roll or light grenade while firing.

‚ñ´️–†–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥—É—é go through the fire, and ignite either when the fire should go out (i.e. after the move) or when the amalgam comes out of mutation.
dungeon.dark.boss.glossary:
🕳 Third Floor:
Opponents: Darkness
{darkness_characteristics}

Passing tips (solo):
‚úÖ Recommended weapons: knife, steel claws, bat, water cannon, saw, revolver.  
‚ùå Few and ineffective weapons: axe, sniper rifle, chain, mace, pole, knuckles, sabre, flamethrower, torch, bow.
‚úÖRecommended abilities: inquisitor, gas mask, alchemist, sadist, berserk, shield generator.
‚ùå Not recommended: pyrotechnician, ninja (roll chance from eyes = 100% and no ninja)

The walkthrough itself:
‚ñ´️ It starts with ‚Äòyou are running away from an evil creature‚Äô, you need to press /suicide (‚ö†️ Very important: suicide should only be pressed when the keyboard appears, otherwise you may unironically die).

‚ñ´️ Move 2: darkness is targeting you, approach (if melee weapon) or attack.
‚ñ´️ Move 3: the darkness should now attack you with one of its eyes, I advise, the first eyes are to roll, roll before the black eyes!


Now the darkness will act like this:
Targeting (🔴/🔵/🟣) > attack > Targeting (🔴/🟣) > attack > attack (‚ö´️)
move 4: Targeting
move 5: Attack
move 6: Targeting
Move 7: Attack
Move 8: Black eye attack

‚ñ´️ If darkness uses 🔴 - shield or extinguish or pray inquisitor, no need to attack! (but you can only if you are wearing a water shield)
‚ñ´️ If darkness uses 🔵 - attack or shield.
‚ñ´️ If darkness uses 🟣 - attack!
‚ñ´️ If darkness uses ‚ö´️ - roll or inquisitor pray for yourself (if you have berserk).

‚ñ´️ While targeting, attack, get rid of fear or reload, as appropriate.

‚ñ´️ Darkness doesn't have a life count, instead it says it lost an eye, you need to make it lose 10 eyes,
‚ñ´️ After you have knocked out her 10 eyes, there will additionally be a ‚Äòrun out of room‚Äô button, you need to press it.
dungeon.dark.boss.darkness_characteristi:
Darkness|👁🌑🌑👁
‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️|10 lives. Maximum: 10
‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️|5 energy. Maximum: 5
💔x1000000/1000000 wounds. Affects loss of lives

‚ñ™️–ì–ª–∞–∑–∞: has 4 eye forms:

1. Red (🔴).  
 - Do 3 damage and set on fire with a power of 6  
   Example: ‚Äò🔥|Alex is on fire! - Loses 5 energy and takes 6 damage.‚Äô  
2. Blue (🔵)  
 - Deals 1 to 3 damage  
 - Stun for 1 turn  
3. Purple (🟣).  
 - Does not deal damage, but inflicts 4 fear.
4. Black (‚ö´️)  
 - Deals 8 damage  
 - Guaranteed to take 2 life  
 - Remove 1 maximum unit of energy

More information on eyes:

‚ñ™️ Black eyes always come after red, blue and purple eyes, i.e. at the end of the cycle.  
‚ñ™️ Red, blue and violet go in random order, BUT, blue eyes are never last.
‚ñ™️ Before the eyes attack, darkness spends a turn, there will be ‚Äòaiming‚Äô. Black, on the other hand, attacks instantly.
‚ñ™️ Has the property of a gas mask - namely, it extinguishes if not set on fire. Light grenades also don't work against it.

Basic darkness attack pattern:
Aim (🔴/🔵/🟣) > attack > Aim (🔴/🔵/🟣) > attack > Aim (🔴/🟣) > attack > attack (‚ö´️)
dungeon.dark.teams.glossary:
Characteristics of darkness in a group:
The darkness has from the number of members, only xp, damage and burning power of red eyes, damage and stun duration of blue eyes grows.

‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️|10 lives. Maximum: 10
- Optional: +5 lives for each player (starting with the second player).
  Example: a duo has 15 lives, a trio has 20 lives, and so on.
‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️|5 energy. Maximum: 5
💔x1000000/1000000 wounds. Affects the loss of lives

‚ñ™️ Eyes: has 4 forms of eyes:

1. Red (🔴).  
 - Do 3 damage and set on fire with a power of 6  
   Example: ‚Äò🔥|Alex is on fire!‚Äô - loses 5 energy and takes 6 damage  
 - Optional: +1 damage and +1 burning for each player (starting with the second player)
2. Blue (🔵)  
 - Deals 1 to 3 damage  
 - Stun for 1 turn  
 - Optional: +1 damage and stun for 1 more turn for each player (starting with the second player).
3. Purple (🟣).  
 - Does not deal damage, but imposes 4 fears
4. Black (‚ö´️)  
 - Deals 8 damage  
 - Guaranteed to take 2 life  
 - Remove 1 maximum unit of energy

More information on eyes:

‚ñ™️ Black eyes always come after red, blue and purple eyes, i.e. at the end of the cycle.  
‚ñ™️ Red, blue and purple go in random order, BUT, blue is never last
‚ñ™️ Before the eyes attack, darkness spends a turn, it will ‚Äòaim‚Äô. Black, on the other hand, attacks instantly.
‚ñ™️ Has the property of a gas mask - namely, it extinguishes if not set on fire. Light grenades also do not work against it.

dungeon.hell.glossary:
🕳 First Floor
Opponents: Three-eyed demon (number of demons = number of players going through the dungeon).

Three-eyed demon|👁👁👁👁
‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️|4 lives. Maximum: 4
‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️|5 energy. Maximum: 5
💔x6/6 wounds. Affects loss of life
Weapon: Tentacles - 2‚ö°️
🎯| 97% chance of hitting.
‚ñ™️ Fire Touch - With a 100% chance on hit it sets fire.
‚ñ™️ You can't knock out weapons with a chain

For effective passing it is recommended:
‚úÖ Water cannon
‚úÖ Gas mask, pyromancer, alchemist

{second_floor}
dungeon.hell.second_floor_glossary:
🕳 Second Floor:
Opponents: Three-eyed Demon, Magma Worm (number of demons and worms = number of players going through the dungeon)

‚ö†️ Very important - on the first turn, you must press skip move/extinguish. (If you have a water cannon, you can use water shield).

Magma Worm|🪱
‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️|3 lives. Max: 3
‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️|3 energy. Maximum: 5
💔x4/4 wounds. Affects loss of life
Weapon: Worm Fangs - 2‚ö°️
🎯|A 88% chance of hitting.
Abilities: 
‚ñ™️ Fire Resistance: The worm doesn't burn at all, but it has a pyromancer bonus.
‚ñ™️ Underground Attack: Worm burrows into the ground (this turn it takes no attack damage, but it can take effects (bleeding, stun, knockdown, etc.)), the next turn it cannot be targeted, and it attacks, knocking the player down.
‚ñ™️ Worm, after losing life, sets everyone on fire with burning power 1 (including demon and other players (amount of xp lost = burning power)).
‚ñ™️ Can't knock out weapons with a chain

Examples of moves:
Move 2:
🕳|Magma Worm 1|🪱 burrows into the ground.
Move 3:
🕳‚ùó️|Magma Worm 1|🪱 bursts out of the ground next to the Player, attacking the target!

For effective playthrough, it is recommended that you:  
‚úÖ Grenade launcher, cleaver, claw, sniper rifle, water cannon, shotgun.
‚úÖ Sadist, scope/vision/vortex, gas mask, alchemist, pyromancer, concentration, bicep, junkie.

Walkthrough tips (solo):
If you have an alchemist, use on yourself on your first turn (only if you don't have a sniper rifle).
The worm has a low damage threshold, a shot from the sniper rifle (8 damage) will completely kill the worm, only the demon will be left to kill.
dungeon.hell.boss.glossary:
🕳 Third Floor:
Opponents: Alastor

{Alastor_characteristics}

‚ñ´️Necromancer's staff, jerk, darkness - they are mandatory, without them you will either pass or fail (in solo at least)
That leaves us with one ‚Äòfree‚Äô ability, I recommend it:
‚úÖRecommended abilities: alchemist, armourer, shield generator, inquisitor.

Walkthrough tips (solo):
‚ñ´️ Use the alchemist (if available) and darkness on yourself (and pray very hard that it doesn't take the form of 2️‚É£ while the darkness is in cd)
The point is that thanks to the darkness, your attacks will get +1 damage, and abilities that have a cooldown will be accelerated (including roll and dash).

Now you just have to slowly kill Alastor by countering his vanshots correctly.

‚ö†️ Try not to summon the Necromancer's staff ‚Äòdead man's rise‚Äô before his attack, firstly, the darkness does not affect the recharge, secondly, the Electric Beam deals damage like a grenade (i.e. attacking all targets), this also applies to corpses, including corpses from the Necromancer's staff.
‚ö†️–í–æ time of dead man's summoning, if possible, try to have 0 energy. Alastor with an electric beam and hypnosis can break through the shield of the necromancer's staff!

‚ö†️–ü–æ—Å–ª–µ the first pass of the dungeon, rolls, normal shields, inquisitor will save you from ‚Äòvanshot attacks‚Äô

🔺After the first pass (i.e. no more vanshots):
1️‚É£🦏 Rhino
‚ñ´️ Rhino attacks, dealing 15 damage.
2️‚É£‚ô®️ Shiver of the Earth
‚ñ´️ Attack deals 3-6 damage + inflicts bleed.
3️‚É£‚ùó️ Scourge
‚ñ´️ Attack deals 1-4 damage.
dungeon.hell.boss.Alastor_characteristic:
Alastor|‚ù§️‍🔥
‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️|10 lives. Maximum: 10
‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️|5 energy. Maximum: 5
💔x8/8 wounds. Affects loss of life
‚ñ™️ Immune to burning - and even cures for it!
‚ñ™️ Hypnosis (makes the target attack itself next turn)
‚ñ™️ Electric Beam (removes energy to 0 and attacks ALL players for the amount of energy removed, i.e. 0 energy - 0 damage, 5 energy - 5 damage (attack occurs after the player's action)).
‚ñ™️ Wunshot Attacks:
1️‚É£🦏 Alastor snaps his fingers - an enraged rhino appears from the depths of hell and stares at the player.  
What to do:  
‚ñ´️ You need to use a Jerk on the rhino - it doesn't matter if it hits or if it has energy. The main thing is to apply the jerk to the rhino and to the player the rhino is looking at.
2️‚É£‚ô®️ Alastor snaps his fingers. The player feels a shiver under his feet...  
What to do:  
‚ñ´️ Need to use Darkness against Alastor.
3️‚É£‚ùó️ Alastor increases in size, horns grow from his head, his smile turns into a grin...  
What to do:  
‚ñ´️ You need to use ‚Äòraising the dead‚Äô (Necromancer's Staff)

Alastor attacks with 1-3 damage almost every turn. 

‚ö†️ Important:  
No rolls (not even ninja), shields, inquisitor or any other actions save if the wrong one is chosen!
dungeon.hell.teams.glossary:
Characteristics of Alastor in a group:
Alastor has from the number of members, grows his xp, damage limit and damage (and also the damage power of vanishing attacks, after the first pass) 

Alastor|‚ù§️‍🔥
‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️‚ô•️|10 lives. Max: 10
- Optional: +5 lives for each player (starting with the second player).
‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️‚ö°️|5 energy. Maximum: 5
💔x8/8 wounds. Affects loss of lives
- Optional: +2 wounds for each player (starting with the second player).

Alastor Damage 1-3
- Extra: +1 damage per player (starting with the second player).

Also, his third vanishing attack attacks ALL players! Be vigilant!
3️‚É£‚ùó️ Alastor grows in size, horns grow from his head, his smile turns into a grin....  

If you passed the dungeon the first time, his attacks will no longer vanshoot, but in a group they are amplified

‚ö†️ After the first dungeon, rolls, normal shields, inquisitor will save you from ‚Äòvanshot attacks‚Äô.

🔺After the first pass (i.e. no longer vanshoot):
2️‚É£‚ô®️ Shiver of the Earth
‚ñ´️ Attack deals 3-6 damage + bleed.
- Optional: +4 max damage per player (starting with the second player).
  i.e. 3-10 for a duo, 3-14 for a trio, etc.
3️‚É£‚ùó️ Scalp
‚ñ´️ Attack deals 1-4 damage to EVERY player.
- Extra: +1 damage for each player (starting with the second player).


‚ñ´️ Necromancer's staff, jerk, darkness - these are mandatory, without them you will either pass or fail.
‚úÖRecommended abilities: necromancer, alchemist, armourer, shield generator, inquisitor.

As a group, the boss stage is very simple

Since some attacks have a target, accordingly, it is this target that you need to do actions (except 3️‚É£ which attacks all players).
Here are a few lifehacks:
‚ñ´️ If possible, take a necromancer; after the death of an ally/npcs from the staff of the necromancer - on cd pick up their corpses; Alastor's vanshot attack and normal attacks will target your zombies!
‚ñ´️When the rhino is about to run at you, the other player throws darkness at the rhino; since the rhino can't get rid of the darkness, you get bonus damage and a bonus cooldown from the darkness!
